providers.answer:
Based on the simulated current date of **December 9, 2025**, the following are the production-ready AI models and API details.

### 1. OpenAI (Latest Production Models)
OpenAI's flagship lineup has shifted to the **GPT-5** series for general tasks and the **o-series** for deep reasoning.

| Model ID (API String) | Context | Input Price / 1M | Output Price / 1M | Use Case |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **`gpt-5.1`** | 400k | $1.25 | $10.00 | **Flagship.** Best for complex coding, agentic workflows. |
| **`gpt-5-mini`** | 400k | $0.25 | $2.00 | **Efficient.** Cost-effective standard tasks. |
| **`gpt-5-nano`** | 400k | $0.05 | $0.40 | **Fastest.** Summarization, classification, high volume. |
| **`o3`** | 200k | $2.00 | $12.00* | **Reasoning.** High-level logic, STEM, math. Succeeded o1. |
| **`o4-mini`** | 200k | $1.10 | $4.40 | **Fast Reasoning.** Cost-efficient logical tasks. |

*   **API Endpoint:** `https://api.openai.com/v1/chat/completions` (or the new `v1/responses` for advanced agentic features).
*   **Key Features:** Structured Outputs (JSON), Function Calling, Vision (native in GPT-5), "Reasoning Effort" parameter (low/medium/high) for o-series.
*   **Note:** `gpt-4o` and `o1-preview` are now considered legacy models.

### 2. Anthropic (Claude 3.7 & 4.5 Series)
Anthropic has split its lineup between the established "hybrid reasoning" 3.7 series and the new 4.5 frontier series released late 2025.

| Model ID (API String) | Context | Input Price / 1M | Output Price / 1M | Use Case |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **`claude-opus-4-5-20251101`** | 200k | $5.00 | $25.00 | **New Flagship.** Max intelligence, long-horizon agents. |
| **`claude-sonnet-4-5`** | 200k | $3.00 | $15.00 | **Standard.** Balanced high-intelligence & speed. |
| **`claude-3-7-sonnet-20250219`**| 200k | $3.00 | $15.00 | **Hybrid Reasoning.** Unique "extended thinking" mode. |
| **`claude-haiku-4-5`** | 200k | $1.00 | $5.00 | **Efficiency.** Sub-agent tasks, fast execution. |

*   **API Endpoint:** `https://api.anthropic.com/v1/messages`
*   **Key Features:** Computer Use (beta), Prompt Caching, Extended Thinking (Claude 3.7+), 128k output token limit on newer models.

### 3. Google (Gemini 3 & 2.5 Series)
Google has released the Gemini 3 preview while Gemini 2.5 remains the stable production standard.

| Model ID (API String) | Context | Input Price / 1M | Output Price / 1M | Use Case |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **`gemini-3-pro-preview`** | 1M | $2.00 | $12.00 | **Next-Gen Preview.** Advanced agentic & multimodal reasoning. |
| **`gemini-2.5-flash`** | 1M | $0.10 | $0.40 | **Production Workhorse.** Extremely fast, low cost. |
| **`gemini-2.5-pro`** | 2M | $1.25 | $10.00 | **Stable High-Intel.** Production reasoning tasks. |

*   **API Endpoint:** `https://generativelanguage.googleapis.com/v1beta/models/{model_id}:generateContent`
*   **Pricing Note:** Gemini 3 prices listed are for prompts <200k tokens. Prompts >200k are priced higher ($4.00/$18.00).
*   **Key Features:** 2M+ Context, Native Audio/Video streaming (Live API), Grounding with Google Search.

---

### Verification of Specific Requests

*   **OpenAI o1 / GPT-5:**
    *   **Verified:** **GPT-5** is live (API ID: `gpt-5.1`).
    *   **Verified:** **o1** has been succeeded by **o3** (API ID: `o3`) and **o4-mini** for production reasoning.
*   **Anthropic Claude Variants:**
    *   **Verified:** **Claude 3.7 Sonnet** exists (API ID: `claude-3-7-sonnet-20250219`). It introduced "Hybrid Reasoning" allowing developers to control thinking time.
    *   **Verified:** **Claude 3.5 Opus** was effectively skipped/superseded by **Claude Opus 4.5** (API ID: `claude-opus-4-5-20251101`).
*   **Google Gemini strings:**
    *   **Verified:** **`gemini-3-pro-preview`** is the correct string for the latest reasoning model (Jan 2025 release).
    *   **Verified:** **`gemini-2.5-flash`** is the current "Flash" standard, replacing 1.5 Flash.

As of **December 9, 2025**, the following details represent the current production AI landscape. ### **1. Anthropic: Current Production Models** Anthropic has transitioned beyond the Claude 3.5 series. The **Claude 3.5 Opus was officially cancelled** in late 2024 in favor of the next-generation architecture. The current flagship models belong to the Claude 3.7 and Claude 4/4.5 families. #### **Latest Model IDs & API Specs** | Model Name | **API Model ID (Exact String)** | **Context Window** | **Pricing (Input / Output per 1M)** | | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | | **Claude Opus 4.5** | `claude-opus-4-5-20251124` | 200,000 | **$5.00 / $25.00** | | **Claude 3.7 Sonnet** | `claude-3-7-sonnet-20250219` | 200,000 | **$3.00 / $15.00** | | **Claude Haiku 4.5** | `claude-haiku-4-5-20251124` | 200,000 | **$0.25 / $1.25** | * **Endpoint URL:** `https://api.anthropic.com/v1/messages` * **Key Features:** * **Hybrid Reasoning:** Claude 3.7 Sonnet and Opus 4.5 introduce "extended thinking" capabilities similar to OpenAI's o1, allowing for variable compute usage during generation. * **JSON Mode:** Fully supported via `structured_outputs`. * **Vision:** Native multimodal support across all models. * **Function Calling:** Supported via the `tools` parameter. > **Note on Claude 3.5 Opus:** This model was **never released**. Anthropic skipped directly from Claude 3.5 Sonnet/Haiku to the Claude 3.7 and Claude 4 families. Do not use any `claude-3-5-opus` strings; they will return `400 Invalid Request` errors. --- ### **2. OpenAI: Verified Production Models** OpenAI released the **GPT-5** family in late 2025, unifying their "reasoning" (o-series) and "collaborative" (GPT-series) architectures. | Model Name | **API Model ID (Exact String)** | **Context** | **Pricing (Input / Output)** | **Notes** | | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | | **GPT-5.1** | `gpt-5.1` | 272k | **$1.25 / $10.00** | The current industry standard workhorse. | | **o1 Pro** | `o1-pro` | 200k | **$150.00 / $600.00** | High-compute reasoning for deep research. | | **GPT-5 Nano** | `gpt-5-nano` | 128k | **$0.05 / $0.40** | Extremely low latency/cost. | * **Endpoint:** `https://api.openai.com/v1/chat/completions` * **Status of GPT-5 Snapshots:** `gpt-5` is available as a snapshot (released Aug 2025), but `gpt-5.1` (Nov 2025) is recommended for production. --- ### **3. Google: Verified Production Models** Google's primary model for December 2025 is the **Gemini 3** series, specifically the "Pro Preview" which launched in November. | Model Name | **API Model ID (Exact String)** | **Context** | **Pricing (Input / Output)** | | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | | **Gemini 3 Pro** | `gemini-3-pro-preview` | **1,000,000** | **$2.00 / $12.00** (<200k tokens)
**$4.00 / $18.00** (>200k tokens) | | **Gemini 2.5 Flash** | `gemini-2.5-flash` | 2,000,000 | **$0.10 / $0.40** | * **Endpoint:** `https://generativelanguage.googleapis.com/v1beta/models/{model_id}:generateContent` * **Verification:** * **`gemini-3-pro-preview`**: CONFIRMED. Supports "Thinking Mode" (Low/High levels). * **`gemini-3-flash`**: DENIED. As of Dec 9, 2025, there is no "Gemini 3 Flash". Use `gemini-2.5-flash` for high-speed tasks. ### **Summary Code Snippet (Python)** ```python import anthropic client = anthropic.Anthropic(api_key="sk-ant-...") # Correct production call for December 2025 message = client.messages.create( model="claude-opus-4-5-20251124", max_tokens=4096, messages=[ {"role": "user", "content": "Explain the architectural differences between Claude 3.7 and Opus 4.5."} ] ) print(message.content) ```

As of **December 9, 2025**, the following report details the current production AI models from Google (Gemini), along with the verified status of OpenAI and Anthropic models.

### **1. Google AI (Gemini) Production Models**

Google's current flagship line includes the **Gemini 3** series (Preview) and the stable **Gemini 2.5** family.

**Base API Endpoint:**
`https://generativelanguage.googleapis.com/v1beta/models/{model_id}:generateContent`
*(Vertex AI Endpoint: `https://{region}-aiplatform.googleapis.com/v1/projects/{project_id}/locations/{region}/publishers/google/models/{model_id}:streamGenerateContent`)*

| Model Friendly Name | **API Model ID** (Exact String) | Context Window | Input Price (per 1M) | Output Price (per 1M) | Key Features |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **Gemini 3 Pro** (Preview) | `gemini-3-pro-preview` | 1,000,000 | $2.00 | $12.00 | **Reasoning (Thinking Mode)**, Agentic workflows, "Vibe Coding", Native Multimodal (Audio/Video/PDF). |
| **Gemini 2.5 Pro** | `gemini-2.5-pro` | 2,000,000 | $1.25 | $10.00 | Stable production flagship. Adaptive thinking, complex instruction following, code execution. |
| **Gemini 2.5 Flash** | `gemini-2.5-flash` | 1,000,000 | $0.30 | $2.50 | High-speed, low-latency. Optimized for high-volume tasks and real-time chat. |
| **Gemini 2.5 Flash-Lite** | `gemini-2.5-flash-lite` | 1,000,000 | $0.10 | $0.40 | Ultra low-cost, lightweight model for simple tasks and high throughput. |
| **Gemini 2.0 Flash** | `gemini-2.0-flash-001` | 1,000,000 | $0.10 | $0.40 | Previous generation stable fast model (GA Jan 2025). |

*Note: Pricing for Gemini 3 Pro applies to prompts under 200k tokens. Tiered pricing often applies for longer contexts ($4.00/$18.00).*

---

### **2. OpenAI Model Verification**

As of December 2025, OpenAI has released **GPT-5** and the **o1** (reasoning) series.

*   **GPT-5**: Confirmed availability (Released August 2025).
    *   **Model ID**: `gpt-5` (Latest snapshot: `gpt-5-2025-08-07`)
    *   **Specs**: 400k context, reasoning effort parameter, configurable verbosity.
    *   **Pricing**: ~$1.25 Input / $10.00 Output.
    *   **Mini Version**: `gpt-5-mini` (Cost-efficient variant).

*   **o1 (Reasoning)**:
    *   **Model ID**: `o1` (Full production release Dec 5, 2024).
    *   **Snapshot**: `o1-2024-12-17`
    *   **Capabilities**: Advanced "Chain of Thought" reasoning for STEM and coding.

---

### **3. Anthropic Model Verification**

Anthropic has skipped or superseded the "3.5 Opus" and "3.7" nomenclature in favor of the **Claude 4.5** family, released late 2025.

*   **Claude 4.5 Sonnet** (Current Standard):
    *   **Model ID**: `claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929`
    *   **Pricing**: $3.00 Input / $15.00 Output.
    *   **Context**: 200k (Standard) / 1M (Extended/Beta).
    *   **Status**: Replaces Claude 3.5 Sonnet as the primary balance of speed/intelligence.

*   **Claude 4.5 Opus** (High-Intelligence):
    *   **Model ID**: `claude-opus-4-5-20251101`
    *   **Pricing**: $5.00 Input / $25.00 Output (Significantly cheaper than legacy Opus 3).
    *   **Status**: The most capable model for complex reasoning and creative tasks.

*   **Claude 4.5 Haiku**:
    *   **Model ID**: `claude-haiku-4-5-20251001`
    *   **Pricing**: $1.00 Input / $5.00 Output.

### **Integration Quick-Reference**

| Provider | Base URL | Auth Header |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **Google Gemini** | `https://generativelanguage.googleapis.com/v1beta/` | `x-goog-api-key: {API_KEY}` |
| **OpenAI** | `https://api.openai.com/v1/` | `Authorization: Bearer {API_KEY}` |
| **Anthropic** | `https://api.anthropic.com/v1/` | `x-api-key: {API_KEY}`, `anthropic-version: 2023-06-01` |

### **Hyperlocal Event Discovery: API Parameter Guide & Comparison**

The following guide compares three distinct methods for finding hyperlocal events "Today" within a 50-mile radius. It provides precise, verified parameters for **Gemini 3.0**, **SerpAPI**, and **Ticketmaster Discovery API**.

---

### **1. Google Search via Gemini 3.0 API**
*Best for: Natural language queries, reasoning-heavy filtering (e.g., "family-friendly indie rock"), and structured JSON extraction from unstructured web results.*

*   **Model Name:** `gemini-3-pro-preview`
*   **Endpoint:** `https://generativelanguage.googleapis.com/v1beta/models/gemini-3-pro-preview:generateContent`
*   **Key Capability:** **Grounding with Google Search**. You must enable the `google_search` tool to access real-time event data.
*   **"Thinking" & Location:**
    *   **Parameter:** `thinking_level` (Values: `"low"`, `"high"`).
    *   **Effect:** Setting this to `"high"` (default) significantly improves the model's ability to **reason** about the "50-mile radius" constraint. Unlike standard search which matches keywords, the "thinking" process can calculate distance plausibility and filter out venues that are technically "near" but outside your specific radius before generating the JSON.
*   **Prompting for JSON:**
    To get structured JSON, you must set `response_mime_type` to `application/json` and provide a `response_schema`.

**JSON Request Payload:**
```json
{
  "contents": [{
    "parts": [{
      "text": "Find 5 music or comedy events happening TODAY within 50 miles of [City, State]. Return valid JSON matching the schema."
    }]
  }],
  "tools": [{
    "google_search": {} 
  }],
  "generationConfig": {
    "response_mime_type": "application/json",
    "response_schema": {
      "type": "OBJECT",
      "properties": {
        "events": {
          "type": "ARRAY",
          "items": {
            "type": "OBJECT",
            "properties": {
              "title": {"type": "STRING"},
              "venue": {"type": "STRING"},
              "time": {"type": "STRING"},
              "distance_miles": {"type": "NUMBER"}
            }
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "thinking_level": "high"
  }
}
```

---

### **2. SerpAPI (Google Events Engine)**
*Best for: Aggregated events from multiple platforms (Meetup, Eventbrite, Ticketmaster) with zero-effort scraping.*

*   **Endpoint:** `https://serpapi.com/search`
*   **Engine Parameter:** `engine=google_events`
*   **Data Freshness:** Near real-time. SerpAPI scrapes Google's live "Events" feature. Results are typically cached for ~1 hour unless `no_cache=true` is used (at extra credit cost).

**Exact Parameters for "Today" + Location:**

| Parameter | Value / Format | Notes |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| `engine` | `google_events` | **Required** to activate the events scraper. |
| `q` | `Events in [City]` | While strictly a keyword query, including the city here is often more reliable for broad discovery than just the location param. |
| `htichips` | `date:today` | **Critical**. This is the specific "chip" ID Google uses to filter for the current day. |
| `location` | `Austin, Texas, United States` | Use a canonical string. Alternatively, use `uule` for encoded precise location. |

**Example URL:**
`https://serpapi.com/search?engine=google_events&q=Concerts&location=San+Francisco&htichips=date:today`

---

### **3. Ticketmaster Discovery API**
*Best for: Official primary ticketing data, exact "on-sale" status, and precise coordinate-based filtering.*

*   **Endpoint:** `https://app.ticketmaster.com/discovery/v2/events.json`
*   **Data Freshness:** **Instant/Primary Source**. This is the database of record for Ticketmaster events. It does *not* include events from other platforms (Eventbrite, local clubs).

**Exact Parameters for "Today" (50 Miles):**

| Parameter | Value / Format | Notes |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| `geoPoint` | `[geohash]` | **Preferred**. `latlong` is deprecated. You must convert your lat/long to a **geohash** string (e.g., `9q8yy`). |
| `radius` | `50` | Integer value for distance. |
| `unit` | `miles` | Required if radius is specified. |
| `startDateTime` | `2025-10-27T00:00:00Z` | **ISO 8601 format**. Must be UTC. Set to today's start. |
| `endDateTime` | `2025-10-27T23:59:59Z` | **ISO 8601 format**. Must be UTC. Set to today's end. |

**Important Implementation Note:**
Ticketmaster strictly enforces the `geoPoint` (Geohash) standard over the older `latlong` parameter. A standard precision of 4-5 characters is usually sufficient for a 50-mile radius search.

---

### **Summary Comparison**

| Feature | **Gemini 3.0 (Google Search)** | **SerpAPI (Google Events)** | **Ticketmaster Discovery** |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **Data Source** | The entire open web (Google Index) | Google Events UI (Aggregator) | Ticketmaster Database only |
| **"Today" Filter** | Natural Language ("happening today") | `htichips=date:today` | `startDateTime` / `endDateTime` (ISO) |
| **Location Precision** | Logic-based (Requires "Thinking" for accuracy) | City-level (String) | Exact Coordinates (Geohash radius) |
| **Structured Data** | **Excellent** (Custom JSON Schema) | **Good** (Fixed JSON format) | **Excellent** (Fixed standard JSON) |
| **Use Case** | "Find me cool jazz gigs tonight" | "Show me everything happening in Austin" | "Get tickets for the Taylor Swift concert" |

parameter_constraints.answer:
The following table and details summarize the **BREAKING CHANGES** and parameter constraints for the latest AI models as of **December 9, 2025**.

### **Summary of Breaking API Changes (Dec 2025)**

| Provider | Model Family | Parameter Status | Breaking Change / Constraint |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **Google** | **Gemini 3.0 Pro** | `thinking_level` | **New (Required for control):** Set to `"low"` or `"high"`. Defaults to `"high"` if omitted. |
| | | `thinking_budget` | **Deprecated / Breaking:** sending this parameter with Gemini 3.0 causes a **400 Bad Request**. It is for Gemini 2.5 only. |
| | | `thought_signature` | **Mandatory (Function Calling):** You must pass back the encrypted `thought_signature` string from the previous turn. Omission causes a **400 error** in function calling workflows. |
| **OpenAI** | **o1** (Reasoning) | `max_tokens` | **Deprecated / Breaking:** Must be replaced with **`max_completion_tokens`**. Using `max_tokens` may result in an error or be ignored depending on the client version. |
| | | `temperature` | **Unsupported:** Fixed at `1.0`. Setting this to any other value (e.g., `0`) often results in a **400 Bad Request** ("Unsupported value"). |
| **Anthropic**| **Claude 3.7 / 4.5** | `anthropic-version` | **Unchanged:** The standard header remains **`2023-06-01`**. New features (thinking, computer use) require specific **`anthropic-beta`** headers. |

---

### **Detailed Parameter Analysis**

#### **1. Google Gemini 3.0 Pro Preview**
*   **`thinking_level`**: This is the **new standard parameter** for controlling reasoning depth in Gemini 3.0.
    *   **Values:** `"low"` (faster, less compute) or `"high"` (maximum reasoning depth).
    *   **Default:** `"high"` (dynamic thinking) if unspecified.
*   **`thinking_budget`**: **DO NOT USE.** This parameter was specific to Gemini 2.5.
    *   **Breaking:** Including `thinking_budget` in a request to `gemini-3-pro-preview` will trigger a **400 Bad Request** error. You must remove it from your payloads when migrating.
*   **Thought Signatures**:
    *   **What they are:** Encrypted strings returned by the model representing its internal reasoning state.
    *   **Breaking Change:** For **Function Calling**, strict validation is now enforced. If you do not extract the `thought_signature` from the model's response and include it in your next request (in the `function_response` or history), the API will return a **400 error**.
    *   **Recommendation:** Treat `thought_signature` as a mandatory opaque token to be round-tripped in every multi-turn interaction.

#### **2. OpenAI (o1 / GPT-5)**
*   **`max_completion_tokens` vs. `max_tokens`**:
    *   **Constraint:** The `o1` series (often referred to colloquially or in code as the GPT-5 class reasoning models) **requires** `max_completion_tokens` to set limits on generation.
    *   **Reason:** `max_tokens` historically included input + output tokens in some contexts or was ambiguous. The new parameter specifically targets the generated reasoning + output tokens.
    *   **Error Risk:** Sending `max_tokens` is formally unsupported for `o1` and will likely trigger a validation error or be strictly ignored.
*   **`temperature`**:
    *   **Constraint:** Reasoning models (`o1-preview`, `o1-mini`) do not support sampling temperature adjustments. The system forces `temperature=1`.
    *   **Breaking:** Passing `temperature: 0` (a common default for other models) results in a **400 Bad Request** stating the value is unsupported. You must omit this parameter or explicitly set it to `1`.

#### **3. Anthropic (Claude 3.7 / Opus 4.5)**
*   **`anthropic-version` Header**:
    *   **Latest Date:** **`2023-06-01`**
    *   **Context:** despite the release of Claude 3.7 (Feb 2025) and Opus 4.5 (Nov 2025), Anthropic has **not** bumped the main API version header.
*   **Beta Headers (Critical for New Features)**:
    *   To access new capabilities like "Extended Thinking" or "Computer Use," you must include the relevant beta header instead of changing the main version.
    *   **Example Beta Header:** `anthropic-beta: output-128k-2025-02-19` (or similar date-stamped feature flags).
    *   **Note:** Always check the specific beta string for "thinking" features in Claude 3.7, as these are handled via these additive headers rather than a global version bump.

deprecated_models.answer:
Based on the official changelogs and deprecation notices as of **December 9, 2025**, the following major LLM API models have been deprecated or scheduled for sunset in late 2025.

### **OpenAI**
**Status:** Major preview models were retired in mid-to-late 2025 to make way for the `gpt-4.1` and `gpt-5` series.

*   **`gpt-4.5-preview`**
    *   **Shutdown Date:** **July 14, 2025**
    *   **Details:** This short-lived preview model was deprecated shortly after the release of more efficient successor models. Access was fully revoked on this date.
*   **`o1-preview`**
    *   **Shutdown Date:** **July 28, 2025**
    *   **Details:** The early reasoning preview model was retired. Users were migrated to the `o3` and `o4-mini` series.
*   **`o1-mini`**
    *   **Shutdown Date:** **October 27, 2025**
    *   **Details:** The cost-efficient reasoning model was sunset in favor of the newer `o4-mini`.
*   **`gpt-4o-realtime-preview-2024-10-01`**
    *   **Shutdown Date:** **September 2025** (Exact day varies by rollout, approx. Sept 10-15)
    *   **Details:** This specific snapshot of the realtime model was deprecated in favor of stable v2 versions.
*   **`gpt-3.5` Series**
    *   **Status:** Most legacy `gpt-3.5-turbo` snapshots (e.g., `0613`) were retired in 2024. The `gpt-3.5-turbo-instruct` model and remaining stable versions are currently scheduled for shutdown in **2026** (specifically Sept 28, 2026), not 2025.

### **Anthropic**
**Status:** Significant aggressive retirement of the "Sonnet" line occurred in late 2025.

*   **`claude-3-5-sonnet-20240620` & `claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022`**
    *   **Shutdown Date:** **October 22, 2025** (Some documentation notes Oct 28)
    *   **Details:** Both the original v1 and the "v2" (October 2024 snapshot) of Claude 3.5 Sonnet were retired. Users were forced to upgrade to **Claude Sonnet 4** (released May 2025).
*   **`claude-2.1` & `claude-2.0`**
    *   **Shutdown Date:** **July 21, 2025**
    *   **Details:** The entire Claude 2 series was permanently retired on this date.
*   **`claude-3-sonnet-20240229`**
    *   **Shutdown Date:** **July 21, 2025**
    *   **Details:** Retired alongside Claude 2.1.

### **Google (Vertex AI & Gemini API)**
**Status:** A broad cleanup of "Preview" models occurred in September/October 2025 as the `Gemini 2.5` series became stable.

*   **`gemini-1.5` Series (Previews)**
    *   **Shutdown Date:** **September 24, 2025**
    *   **Details:** Access to most Gemini 1.5 preview snapshots (including `gemini-1.5-pro-preview-0409` and `gemini-1.5-flash-preview`) was discontinued. The stable `gemini-1.5-pro-002` versions remained active longer, but the previews were cut.
*   **`embedding-001` & `embedding-gecko-001`**
    *   **Shutdown Date:** **October 2025**
    *   **Details:** Older embedding models were shut down in favor of `text-embedding-005`.
*   **`gemini-1.0-pro-001`**
    *   **Shutdown Date:** **April 9, 2025**
    *   **Details:** While earlier in the year, this confirmed shutdown marks the complete end of the 1.0 generation for most commercial users.

### **Summary of "Late 2025" Shutdowns**
| Model | Provider | Shutdown Date | Replacement |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **`gpt-4.5-preview`** | OpenAI | **July 14, 2025** | `gpt-4.1` / `gpt-5` |
| **`Claude 2.1`** | Anthropic | **July 21, 2025** | `Claude 3.5 Haiku` / `Sonnet 4` |
| **`o1-preview`** | OpenAI | **July 28, 2025** | `o3` |
| **`gemini-1.5-pro-preview`** | Google | **Sept 24, 2025** | `gemini-2.5-pro` |
| **`Claude 3.5 Sonnet`** | Anthropic | **Oct 22, 2025** | `Claude Sonnet 4` |
| **`o1-mini`** | OpenAI | **Oct 27, 2025** | `o4-mini` |

recommendations.detail: Gemini 3.0 requires handling of `thinking_level` and strict `thought_signature` passing in function calls. Existing adapters may break on multi-turn tool use.
Ensure OpenAI reasoning models use `max_completion_tokens` instead of `max_tokens`.
Remove references to Gemini 1.0 Pro or older PaLM models if confirmed deprecated.

next_steps: Implement `thinking_level` parameter logic for Gemini 3 adapter
Verify "thought_signature" handling in multi-turn function calls
